turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Where's the old half--Mexican?

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Took the kids to his Mom's for the weekend.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Guess it's hard to explain how amazin' a human brain is to someone who that's all they know.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Stuff you can never imagine. Feelings. Big thoughts. And love. Yeah. I'm inclined to parlay it into somethin' more. So, go ahead there, beautiful, and take off your shirt.

turns.speaker: BRENDA
turns.text: Grant? Grant, I'm hungry. I'm so fuckin' hungry I think I'm gonna die.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Brought you munchies.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Meat.

turns.speaker: BUTCHER
turns.text: Howdy, Mr. Grant. You goin' to the Deer Cheer this weekend?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Sure thing, killer.

turns.speaker: BUTCHER
turns.text: What can I do you for?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Thinkin' 'bout getting me a couple of these big ol' rib eyes.

turns.speaker: BUTCHER
turns.text: How many you need?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Hell, what am I holding back for? Why don't you just give me everything you got here?

turns.speaker: BUTCHER
turns.text: All the rib eyes?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Yep. And while you're at it, get me a few of them chicken wings... some pork loins... and, ooo, what's this here? Osso buco?...

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: He's teaching environmental science, Grant. Probably wants to borrow my lesson plans from last semester.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Oh yeah, that's what he wants to borrow, this guy.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: It's just a work thing.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Work thing hell, Starla. He just wants to get in your pussy. Him and most these other ones around here. That's where their minds is at, them sick fucks.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Grant, no -- I'm sorry, I'm just -- I'm not in the mood. Grant is on top of her, breathing a little too heavy. GRANT Come on, baby, it's --

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: I'm sorry. I don't just have some switch.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Sure you do.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Flip.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: That's disrespectful.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I'm just some big clown to you, ain't I?

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: That's not true -- Where are you--?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Out.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: I never danced in a towel before.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Wearing white, just like on our... wedding day. I remember it.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Welcome home.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Grant? Why are there -- did you put locks on the garage?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Yeahhhh. I'm sorry. I just got so excited about... your present.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: My present?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You're my princess, aren't you?

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I got a super--special birthday present for you this year. I couldn't risk you finding it, so I had to put them locks on the doors.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: You're pretty.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: It's just one of my students, Grant.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Grant. Oh my God. What happened to your -- ?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Heh. It ain't as bad as it looks, sugarplum. Dr. Carl was just here. I had a reaction to a bee sting. He gave me a prescription. Said I should be fine, in a couple days.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: I'll get if for you.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: No! No. Heh. I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Why'd you betray me, sugarplum?!

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Grant, no!

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: I loved you. I loved --

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Grant, you're sick!

turns.speaker: KYLIE
turns.text: But not always. I was -- He was... other stuff too.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: What other stuff?

turns.speaker: KYLIE
turns.text: Now he's here. He went in Mr. Grant.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: Through a wound on his stomach?

turns.speaker: KYLIE
turns.text: He took him over. His body. His -- his brain, everything what he knew. He's only been dumb stuff before amoeba--things, and rhino--things. He liked being human. Didn't want to change.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: And you said the worms are part of him. They're all linked, like one creature?

turns.speaker: KYLIE
turns.text: When one sees you they all see you.

turns.speaker: STARLA
turns.text: An animal that doesn't procreate. It spreads, grows. A living disease.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Ain't no mystery to it. She's raised in them shanties off St. Luc. Dirt--poor.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Gold--digger, huh?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: So he drags the cow backwards here. Only he prolly didn't know 'bout the Castavets had them dogs.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Hey, look!

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Where'd he go?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: We ain't never gonna find that girl now.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Praise Jesus.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: 'Praise Jesus?' That's fucking pushing it, Margaret.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Maybe you better sit back down. You don't look so good.

turns.speaker: TREVOR
turns.text: Margaret.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Just the man who's gonna see you driven to your knees! Sheriff Buell Clayton from Texas.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Not that I don't have any respect for the law, but what's your problem, man?

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: You.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Yeah, well I kinda figured that.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: You know, you may think you're gonna get away, but I promise you, everytime you turn around, I'll be there, breathing down your neck.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Well, if your breath is as sweet as your personality, I got a lot to look forward to. Adios.

turns.speaker: CLAYTON
turns.text: Get your hands off my daughter!

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Your what?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Aw, ain't you glad to see me, Bandit?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Yeah, it's the highlight of my day.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: What's he get if he wins here?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: I can't believe there's two thousand people here to watch a bunch of guys back up their trucks.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: America's bored.  Now, what do you want?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: You to forget this dumbass Roadeo and take on a real challenge.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You're crazy, man. Smart dresser, but crazy.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: What's the matter? Legend has it Bandit LaRue's king of the road.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I can make it to Texarkana and back in twenty-eight hours... that's no sweat.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: I hear a few weeks ago you smuggled sixteen Beaners up to West Virginia.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You know how rumors start.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Look, you make this little run for me, I'll buy you a new rig.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Last year, this was a new rig.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: But it wasn't a Kenworth.

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: I got a boy running in the Peach Tree Classic tomorrow and when he wins, I wanna celebrate in style.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: How much style?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: Four hundred cases worth.  Well?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You paying for the gas?

turns.speaker: KYLE
turns.text: You got my barley pop?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Okay. I was in Texas dancing in an industrial show for Sunkist Oranges. They say I'm the new Anita Bryant. But I'm really a dancer from New York. A lot of credits. Moderate talent.  Anyway, after opening night, I was walking back to the motor lodge and suddenly there he was. A tall Texan with a twenty-nine inch waist. Pure dynamite.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: All sound reasons for matrimony.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Look, I'm a twenty-eight year old hoofer who spends most of her time with fags. Besides, I'm impulsive. It runs in the family. We're all crazy. Mind if I smoke?  Anyway, today was the 'bid day.' But as I was walking down the aisle, I realized this is total insanity. What am I going to do in Texas the rest of my life? I can't marry Jerry Jeff. I mean, we're eventually gonna have to talk. So, halfway down the aisle, I turned and split. You think I'm nuts, right?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Absolutely not. In fact, I picked up a bride yesterday; except she was a singer.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Kate McConnell.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Kate McConnell. Sweet, shy... well- dressed. I'm giving her a lift to the next waterhole.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Why're you driving so fast?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I gotta get back to Atlanta in thirteen hours.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Why? You have a bowling date?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Cute. No, 'cause no one's ever made it from Atlanta to Texarkana and back in twenty-eight hours.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Who'd want to?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I never looked at it that way.  You ask a lot of questions.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Why are you doing this obviously macho feat?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: For a new Kenworth. That's a truck.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: A truck? You're doing this for a truck? That's insanity.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: It's not a truck. It's the Rolls Royce of eighteen-wheelers.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: But you could get killed, right?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Hey, you could get killed crossing the street.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: An existentialist.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Eyes on the road.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: So tell me about yourself.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well?...

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Whaddya want to know? My sign?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: No. I want to know what you think about besides ditching Smokey?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Having fun.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Is this fun?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Driving?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Driving, talking to me...

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: They're both a challenge.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You have a great profile.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Yeah, I do. Especially from that angle.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Where you from?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Mattoon, Illinois. But I moved down south to work in the Civil Rights movement.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Seriously?!?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Would I lie to you?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Guess what?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I give up.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You just passed your nemesis.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What the hell's going on?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I forget to tell you. I'm running blocker for four hundred cases of illegal brew.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Anything?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: We're cool. The dumb schmuck took the wrong turn.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Can I ask you something?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Shoot.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What do you want to be when you grow up?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You know, you're not a bad driver.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You know, you're not a bad passenger.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: That's a Texas cop. What the hell's he doing in Arkansas?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe Jerry Jeff sent the heat after us.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: A Texas Bear in Arkansas.  Something's up and at this point in my life, I don't want to know what it is.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You know, my mother was a dancer, too. Her big shot was the touring company of 'Brigadoon.' She's been married three times. To a redneck, a poet and her tennis instructor.  See, I motor-mouth when I get nervous. I was nervous when I first got into the car. Now I'm scared shitless.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Believe me, there's nothing to be afraid of.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: We lost him.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Your honeymoon would've never been this exciting.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I don't know. We were planning on seeing the Astrodome.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Christ, what channel are we on?...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Eleven.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: The bus'll pick you up over there.  Uh... you got enough bread for a ticket?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Enough to get to Jersey. I'll walk the rest of the way. I've been sitting a long time.  Nice meeting you. It's been a trip.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Hey...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Enjoy your Kenworth.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Jesus!!!

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Trucker coffee. It's three times stronger. Good for a hundred miles. That, a coupla perks, and you can leap tall buildings in a single bound.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: See ya, Kate.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Ciao.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?!?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He's after us again!

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You know this guy, don't you?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I've never seen him before in my life. I'm just trying to help you out.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: By stealing my car?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I would've come back for you.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Look, the truth is, I didn't want to be dumped at the truck stop. I wanted to go on with you. I needed an excuse.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You could've asked.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You might have said no. I have trouble handling rejection.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Where did you learn how to drive like this?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Mississippi's the other way!

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You want to lose this putz or not?!?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: -- You know, I used to be a high fashion model. Tried it for six months and almost freaked. Makeup, silly clothes, a little man saying 'darling' every two seconds...

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Yeah, it's tough when your cheek- bones are your main asset.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Uh-oh.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Let's hit it.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Nice meeting you, Cledus. Keep on truckin'.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You plan on driving trucks all your life?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: No, actually I was thinking of becoming a brain surgeon.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: -- Trucking ain't the easiest life in the world. I mean, you can't make it much past fifty and you sure as shit don't get a gold watch when you hang it all up. But I like keeping on the move. You know?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Do I know? I'm an authority on it.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I guess if there's one lesson I've learned, it's that even misery has a tough time hitting a moving target.  I forgot your question?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You plan on driving trucks all your life?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I... uh... I don't know. I guess don't like to think about it.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Then let's change the subject.  What do you think about forced school busing?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: An unmarked police car.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I know.  Bandit two, bring yourself on in.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I'm sure the Arkansas Bears put out an all-points.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: You take the front, I'll take the back.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I'm proud of you.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You only smoked three cigarettes through the entire state of Mississippi.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Kate...

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Ummm?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I been thinking. Maybe I should drop you in Montgomery. I mean, the way things are going, it might get pretty hairy by the time we get to Atlanta.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Forget it. This is one of the longest relationships I've ever had. I'm not blowing it now.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: -- Actually, my heaviest relationship was with a rock singer named Ramblin' Bobby Holt. When I turned twenty- one, I went to Europe with visions of being free and independent. My luck, he was on the plane. I landed in Paris and fell in love before I could claim my baggage.  We were together for almost a year. I thought he was it.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He wasn't. One day I came home and found him taking a shower -- with another girl. And her sister.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: My very words.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Well, that's what you get for falling in love with a guy who's first name is Ramblin'.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: They should arrest people for obeying the speed limit.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Bandit II?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: -- It's hard to believe this schmuck Kyle would go to such lengths for Coors beer.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: It's not the beer. He just wants to see me fail.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What kind of a guy is he?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: The minute you see him, you'll know.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What are you gonna do when you get home?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Sleep for a week.  Wanna join me?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Why are you stopping?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Weight Station.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: One to five?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Maybe six months with good behavior.  One to five.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Well, at least it hasn't been boring.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Well, thanks for the lift.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Hey...

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What can I say?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Promise me you won't fall in love with an inmate.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: He's just exhausted.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: That man is your father?!?

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: I should've told you, but you would've thrown me out, right?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Listen, he's nuts. I mean certifiable. But believe it or not, he once looked great in Levis. That's why my mother married him. But like all good things...  I know what you're thinking.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: What are you thinking?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: You gotta admire the man's determination.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: See ya, Bandit.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: See ya, Kate.

turns.speaker: HOT PANTS
turns.text: Why should I?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Because I need your help, sweet thing.  And I need it bad.

turns.speaker: HOT PANTS
turns.text: I'm working, Bandit. Besides, what's the matter? Won't your new girl friend help you?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Hot Pants, please. I'm gonna be flying by in about five minutes with Smokey on my tail. Can you lock it off behind me?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: What do you want me to do, Hot Pants? Beg?

turns.speaker: HOT PANTS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I'm begging.

turns.speaker: HOT PANTS
turns.text: I want you to know I'm doing this against my better instincts.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: But you'll do it?

turns.speaker: HOT PANTS
turns.text: I'll do it.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I owe you a big one, Hot Pants.

turns.speaker: HOT PANTS
turns.text: You sure do.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: What's your pleasure?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Couple of cheeseburgers, no condiments...

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: No what?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Nothing on 'em and two cups of mud; one while I'm waiting.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Order up!

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: That's me.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Sure I can't interest you in anything else?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Another time.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Cledus.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Wake up, man; I just got us a hot run for big bucks.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Whadda we have to do -- kidnap the Pope?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: How'd you know?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Twenty-eight hours! You're outta your gord.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Is that any way to talk to your ole partner?  Look, it's only nine hundred miles each way.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: That means we gotta average ninety- four miles per.  Forget it.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: No one's ever done it before. This'll put us on the map.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Or in the slammer.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Did I tell you they're gonna give us a brand new Kenworth?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Waynette!

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Believe me, man; Fred'll be no problem.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Yeah, I can tell he's gonna be a major asset.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: You know of course, we ain't ever gonna make it.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Quit being so negative, guy; 'course we're gonna make it. We ain't never not made it, have we?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: See.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Our asses gonna be in a sling if we get caught.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: And if we don't, they're gonna be riding high in a brand new Kenworth.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: How long's this gonna take?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: I don't know, man. Ask him?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: We gotta let the slack out, Cledus; this is costing us time.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: If you ask me, I think we should make that run to Choo Choo Town and pick up that load of lumber. Nice. Easy. And within the law.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Also boring.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: But I still don't think...

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: What are you doin' now?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Running blocker.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: All right, here's our plan of communication, so as to avoid Smokey.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Go.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Now, if I say go to channel three, it really means go to six.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Six. Got it.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: If I say go to twenty-one, go to nineteen.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Twenty-one is nineteen.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: If I say go to two, it's really one.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Two is one.  Listen, let's just stay on the odd channels and switch everytime. Start in the basement. Now, let's haul ass.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: You're wall to wall and tree top tall.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: I'm gonna run a couple miles ahead of you. Keep both feet on the floor. We'll be moving ninety and over.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Bandit?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Why are we doing this?

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Because they said it couldn't be done.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Loud and clear.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Pull your hammer back, Smokey's coming at you.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: He's history.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Okay, we got a straight shot to T Town, so let her roll.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Shit! No one's here.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: That's 'cause we're damn near an hour ahead of schedule.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Let's keep it that way.

turns.speaker: CLEDUS
turns.text: Liquid gold.

turns.speaker: BANDIT
turns.text: Redneck heaven.
